snippet: Federal officials said the labeling changes would “help improve the thoughtful prescribing” of medicines like OxyContin.
abstract: Food and Drug Administration announces changes to labeling requirements for long-acting painkillers like OxyContin, in further effort to curb prescription drug abuse, which now takes more American lives than car accidents or gunshot wounds.

byline.contributor: Barry Meier contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Federal officials said the labeling changes would “help improve the thoughtful prescribing” of medicines like OxyContin.

headline.main: To Cut Abuse, F.D.A. Is Altering Painkiller Label Rules
headline.print_headline: To Cut Abuse, F.D.A. Is Altering Painkiller Label Rules
